column6: Work-related injuries
column13: The established approach to safety performance metrics is based on lost time and injury frequency rates. However, such frequency rate data provides no predictive value about future incidents and broadly tells us little about safety. With the development of this new Standard, we aim to embed an alternative approach that actively assesses the state of safety while being objectively measurable and comparable across organisations.\t

column6: Work-related ill health
Average hours of training per year per employee
column13: Continued expansion of our Virtual Reality (VR) vehicle training programs. QUBE Holdings has developed and simulated our QUBE Holdings VR World at all QUBE Holdings Ports sites. This technology allows our staff to use our VR training units to train in any port from anywhere.
column20: Virtual Reality Training, Skills Development, Technology Adoption

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column7: We also took further steps to encourage employee retention, with three-quarters of roles filled by internal promotion and the number of personal and professional development training hours through our partnership with LinkedIn Learning rising to 458.

column13: In FY24, we will review our mandatory "unconscious bias" training to ensure up-to-date, relevant and appropriate content. This training forms part of the compulsory program and will be elevated to provide a more profound awareness across all recruiting activities.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: QUBE Holdings has proudly partnered with the Pinnacle Foundation - a leading charity for Australia's LGBTIQ+ community, providing educational scholarships, mentoring, and other opportunities to young LGBTIQ+ Australians Ã¢ÂÂ since 2021. This year, QUBE Holdings team member Sam joined with other Pinnacle Foundation partners to march in the 2023 Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, representing our company's support for the annual event and all that it represents.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: As champions of Inclusion, QUBE Holdings stands against homophobia, biphobia, interphobia and transphobia. On May 17, we joined with 130 other countries across the world to recognise International Day Against Homophobia, Biphobia, Interphobia and Transphobia.

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: QUBE Holdings is proud to partner with UNIQ You - an online service that promotes career advice for and the career progression of girls and young women. The platform invites young women to complete a quiz, helping to establish their areas of interest and aspects of their personalities. It then pairs them with an advisor who, through online video calls, will mentor them, provide information, and help them build links with other females working in the industry they're interested in.

Operations that have been subject to human rights reviews or impacts assessments
column13: During FY23, QUBE Holdings continued implementing actions under its Human Rights Policy based on its ongoing risk-based assessments of QUBE Holdings's operations and supply chains to identify modern slavery risks. During the period, QUBE Holdings refined its modern slavery due diligence protocol and questionnaire, aiming to elicit more precise and targeted responses from suppliers and to support the assessment, remediation, follow-up and reporting of modern slavery risks.
column20: Modern Slavery Risk Assessment, Supply Chain Transparency, Human Rights

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column7: From 1 July 2022 to 30 June 2023, 609 employees completed comprehensive modern slavery training.

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Through our ongoing support for the Hope Hospitality Foundation, QUBE Holdings continues to work closely with Neil Perry, the Department of Agriculture, Fisheries and Forestry and Woolworths Supermarkets to turn rice that would otherwise have gone to landfill following testing by Australian Biosecurity into meals for those who need them most. The Hope Hospitality Foundation (previously known as Hope Delivery) was initially created to help feed the disadvantaged during COVID, with the recently relaunched charity now widening its remit to help even more Sydneysiders.
column20: Food Waste Reduction, Community Support, Social Impact

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Clontarf Foundation exists to improve the education, discipline, life skills, self-esteem and employment prospects of young Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander men. QUBE Holdings has supported the work of Clontarf since 2017, both as a sponsorship partner and as an employer of trainers. Throughout the year, we had the opportunity to connect with boys from several Clontarf Academies throughout Australia, including hosting a visit to our Sydney office from the boys from Woree Academy near Cairns and supporting two boys from the Bairnsdale Clontarf Academy to complete their schoolwork experience at our QUBE Holdings Logistics operations in Melbourne.
column20: Indigenous Education, Community Engagement, Social Responsibility

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column8: Supporting Cyclone Relief In New Zealand
column13: When Cyclone Gabrielle hit the North Island of New Zealand's uppermost region on February 12 2023, the Prime Minister described it as New Zealand's most significant natural disaster of the century. With authorities working around the clock to conduct rapid assessments of the damage, distribute food and other essential resources, and locate a growing number of missing people, our New Zealand-based team, ISO Limited, rolled up their sleeves to lend a hand.
column20: Disaster Relief, Community Assistance, Emergency Response
